meanings.definition: A room in a ship where the boilers and machinery are located.
meanings.sent1: The firerooms on the ship were hot and noisy with all the machinery.
meanings.sent2: The crew worked diligently in the firerooms to keep the ship running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The firerooms were so loud that the sailors had to shout to hear each other.
meanings.sent4: In the depths of the ship, the firerooms hummed like a giant, metal heart.
meanings.sent5: The clangs and hisses from the firerooms echoed through the entire vessel.

meanings.definition: The plural form of fireroom, referring to multiple rooms in a ship where the boilers and machinery are located.
meanings.sent1: The firerooms of the ship were interconnected, creating a maze of machinery.
meanings.sent2: Engineers inspected all the firerooms regularly to ensure everything was in working order.
meanings.sent3: The firerooms looked like a complex puzzle of pipes and valves to the untrained eye.
meanings.sent4: As the ship sailed, the firerooms pulsed with the rhythm of the engines.
meanings.sent5: The crew knew every corner of the firerooms like the back of their hands.
